name: CI/CD Pipeline   # The name of your workflow, shown in GitHub Actions UI

on:
  push:
    branches: [ "main" ]   # Trigger workflow whenever code is pushed to the "main" branch

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest   # GitHub provides a fresh Ubuntu VM to run this job
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        # Step 1: Checkout your repository code into the runner
        # Without this, the workflow has no access to your project files

      - name: Set up JDK 17
        uses: actions/setup-java@v3
        with:
          java-version: '17'
          distribution: 'temurin'
        # Step 2: Install Java JDK 17 (Temurin distribution) on the runner
        # Needed because your project is a Spring Boot app built with Maven

      - name: Build with Maven
        run: mvn clean package -DskipTests
        # Step 3: Build your project using Maven
        # "clean" removes old build files
        # "package" compiles and packages into a JAR
        # "-DskipTests" skips running tests during CI build

      - name: Login to Docker Hub
        uses: docker/login-action@v2
        with:
          username: ${{ secrets.DOCKERHUB_USERNAME }}
          password: ${{ secrets.DOCKERHUB_TOKEN }}
        # Step 4: Authenticate to Docker Hub using GitHub Secrets
        # Secrets store sensitive info securely (username & token)

      - name: Build and Push Docker image
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v4
        with:
          context: .   # Build context is the root of your repo
          push: true   # Push the image to Docker Hub after building
          tags: duls69/newsportal:latest
        # Step 5: Build Docker image from your project and push to Docker Hub
        # The image is tagged as "duls69/newsportal:latest"

      - name: Deploy to VPS via SSH
        uses: appleboy/ssh-action@v0.1.10
        with:
          host: ${{ secrets.VPS_HOST }}     # VPS IP/hostname stored in secrets
          username: ${{ secrets.VPS_USER }} # VPS login user stored in secrets
          key: ${{ secrets.VPS_SSH_KEY }}   # SSH private key stored in secrets
          script: |
            cd $HOME || exit 1
            # Step 6a: Go to the home directory of the VPS user
            # Exit if $HOME doesn't exist (safety check)

            if [ ! -d "springboot-news-portal" ]; then
              git clone https://github.com/abdlroman/springboot-news-portal.git
              cd springboot-news-portal
              # Step 6b: If repo folder doesn't exist, clone it from GitHub
              # Then move into the cloned folder
            else
              cd springboot-news-portal
              git pull
              # Step 6c: If repo already exists, go inside and pull latest changes
            fi

            docker pull duls69/newsportal:latest
            # Step 7: Pull the latest Docker image from Docker Hub

            docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d
            # Step 8: Use docker-compose.yml to start (or update) containers
            # "-d" runs in detached mode (background)
